intro: Gussonia estrellensis, commonly known as the Estrellan firetail, is a strikingly ornamental plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as the "red-hot pokers." This species is characterized by its vibrant red, orange, and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in well-drained, sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Gussonia estrellensis is valued for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
